body:
Using only a requirements.yaml (no requirements.lock or charts/) and running helm install --dep-up does not deploy the required charts. It does download the charts and create the requirements.lock, but it does not get deployed to kubernetes unless it has been previously been downloaded. It expected it to automatically deploy the charts within the requirements.yaml.

```shell
$ helm version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.8.0", GitCommit:"14af25f1de6832228539259b821949d20069a222", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Server: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.8.0", GitCommit:"14af25f1de6832228539259b821949d20069a222", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

```shell
$ git clone https://github.com/steven-sheehy/helm-dep-up.git
$ helm install --dep-up helm-dep-up
Hang tight while we grab the latest from your chart repositories...
...Unable to get an update from the "local" chart repository (http://127.0.0.1:8879/charts):
	Get http://127.0.0.1:8879/charts/index.yaml: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:8879: getsockopt: connection refused
...Successfully got an update from the "stable" chart repository
Update Complete. ⎈Happy Helming!⎈
Saving 1 charts
Downloading mongodb-replicaset from repo https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com/
Deleting outdated charts
NAME:   hipster-echidna
LAST DEPLOYED: Tue Jan 30 17:09:00 2018
NAMESPACE: default
STATUS: DEPLOYED

RESOURCES:
==> v1/Pod
NAME   READY  STATUS             RESTARTS  AGE
nginx  0/1    ContainerCreating  0         0s

NOTES:
Your chart has been successfully released.
To check it's state, run:
  helm status hipster-echidna
```

However, if I do a helm dep up followed by a helm install it does work:
```shell
$ git clone https://github.com/steven-sheehy/helm-dep-up.git
$ helm dep up helm-dep-up && helm install helm-dep-up
Hang tight while we grab the latest from your chart repositories...
...Unable to get an update from the "local" chart repository (http://127.0.0.1:8879/charts):
	Get http://127.0.0.1:8879/charts/index.yaml: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:8879: getsockopt: connection refused
...Successfully got an update from the "stable" chart repository
Update Complete. ⎈Happy Helming!⎈
Saving 1 charts
Downloading mongodb-replicaset from repo https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com/
Deleting outdated charts
NAME:   deadly-terrier
LAST DEPLOYED: Tue Jan 30 17:11:13 2018
NAMESPACE: default
STATUS: DEPLOYED

RESOURCES:
==> v1/ConfigMap
NAME                                     DATA  AGE
deadly-terrier-mongodb-replicaset        1     1s
deadly-terrier-mongodb-replicaset-tests  1     1s

==> v1/Service
NAME                               TYPE       CLUSTER-IP  EXTERNAL-IP  PORT(S)    AGE
deadly-terrier-mongodb-replicaset  ClusterIP  None        <none>       27017/TCP  1s

==> v1/Pod
NAME   READY  STATUS             RESTARTS  AGE
nginx  0/1    ContainerCreating  0         1s

==> v1beta1/StatefulSet
NAME                               DESIRED  CURRENT  AGE
deadly-terrier-mongodb-replicaset  3        1        1s

NOTES:
Your chart has been successfully released.
To check it's state, run:
  helm status deadly-terrier
```
title: helm install --dep-up doesn't deploy downloaded charts
